Class ClickerActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper

          • android.app.Activity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, ShakeToClean.ShakeToCleanCallback

    public class ClickerActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements ShakeToClean.ShakeToCleanCallback
    The main activity of this SmoothClicker app. It shows the configuration widgets to set up the click actions
    Since:
    02/03/2016
    Version:
    2.31.0
    Author:
    pylapp
    See Also:
    AppCompatActivity, ShakeToClean.ShakeToCleanCallback

      • handleExit

        private void handleExit()
        Displays a "do you want to exit" pop-up, and if the user clicks on OK, will stop all clicks process and finish.

      • handleStandaloneMode

        private void handleStandaloneMode()
        Handles the standalone mode (when the user has clicked on the dedicated menu item). Disable the mode if is was running. Displays a list with the action to process in such mode. When the user chooses an option is this list, finish this activity and starts the standalone one with the dedicated intent.

      • handleMultiPointResult

        private void handleMultiPointResult(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> coords)
        Handles the list of coordinates of the points to click on. Will update the list showing to the user the points. Will update the config so as to allow the ATClicker to click on all these points.
        Parameters:
        coords - - The list of X/Y values of the points to click on as {x0, y0, x1, y2, ..., xN, yN} If null, the list will be made empty

      • startSettingsActivity

        private void startSettingsActivity()
        Starts the settings activity

      • startSelectPointActivity

        private void startSelectPointActivity()
        Starts the activity which allows the user to select a point on its screen

        private void showInSnackbarWithoutAction(java.lang.String message)
        Displays in the snack bar a message
        Parameters:
        message - - The string to display. Will do nothing if null or empty

      • showInSnackbar

        private void showInSnackbar(java.lang.String message,
                            java.lang.String action,
                            android.view.View.OnClickListener callback)
        Displays in the snack bar a message with dedicated action and callback
        Parameters:
        message - - The string to display. Will do nothing if null or empty
        action - - The action
        callback - - The callback to trigger when click on the action
